page.title: 17SAMLESBURY SURVEY 1931
page.content: FROM THE SCHOOL'S OLD LOG BOOK. June 1931 ' The board of Education have asked the rural schools to make a survey of the country immediately surrounding them, for the purpose of showing to what uses the land is put. I recieved two ordance maps of the Samlesbury district, and have been given permission to take classes out during school hours to do the work of the survey.' During the month of June 1931, the children of standards 11 to Vll were taken out for walks to different parts of the parish to survey the fields on either side of the lanes and roads.They were provided with traced maps, and trees, flowers and birds were also observed. The children who did the survey would be from 7 to 13 years old.
